CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 14, 1951, pg. 24, reads: "JUNIORS OF HOMEWOOD - BRUSHTON UNIT, URBAN LEAGUE - The Juniors of the Homewood-Brushton Unit of the Urban League did so well at their bake sale to raise money for the Termon Avenue Children's Home that they held a party afterward. Left to right: President Joyce Boulden, Geraldine Griffie, vice president; Francine Walker, secretary; Geraldine Toler, corresponding secretary; Beverly Scott, assistant secretary; Muriel Henry, membership secretary, and Carole Vaughn, Fifia Hoskin, Janis Monroe, Myra Monroe, Ruthman Washington, Bob Scott, Patsy McGuire, Phyllis Owens, Sybol Owens, Mrs. Edythe V. Sandidge and Mrs. Doris Dyer, sponsor. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of eighteen children of Juniors of Homewood-Brushton Unit of the Urban League, including: Joyce Boulden, Geraldine Griffie, Francine Walker, Geraldine Toler, Beverly Scott fourth from left in second row, Muriel Henry, Carole Vaughn, Fifia Hoskin, Janis Monroe, Myra Monroe, Ruthman Washington, Elmer Robert "Bobby" Scott Jr. fourth from left in first row, Patsy McGuire, Phyllis Owens, Sybol Owens, and two women, sponsors Edythe V. Sandidge and Doris Dyer, posed behind table with striped cups and plates of food, for party
